My favvvv place to eat at. The pupusas are sooo good and fresh. They're handmade at the moment when you purchase so it may take a little bit to get your pupusas but it's so worth it. The sopa de res too is sooo good. The flavor is so good and not a plain soup. 5/5 stars<3

I have only ever had the pupusas (veganized - beans/mushrooms/jalape√±os) and they are super tasty. They are made fresh on demand and are accomodating with the combos. The natural juices are a bit on the sugary side. One down side is that it is cash only but there is an atm on site.

This place was ok. Thus far. I've only tried the pork pupusas. It was the first time I've tried them. They were ok. The cabbage salad and the sauce were the saving graces of the meal.  I will leave this review open ended until I get another 2 dishes to bring the rating up. But at the moment, it's a 3 thus far.

The worse place to buy food, specially if placing order over the phone. I recently order a red snaper, I specifically ask the person whose taking my order what are the size of the fish. Because the asking price was $18.00 for the platter. She answered " they are big, they good size". When I pick up my order I received a small baby red snaper fish that can easily fit the palm of my hands and the fish was hard as a rock due to over frying the fish. The fish tasted like leftover that was sitting in the freezer, Not fresh. check your order before paying at that restaurant. If ordering red snaper fish check your order before paying they might do you the same.
Great food but mannn poor the waitress, it's only one lady serving the entire place... She does a good job but the owners should be more conscious... That poor lady does work for 2 people.
